conclusion: For an ideal gas, the quantity p V is proportional to the absolute temperature T.
State A: p_A = 3 × 10⁵ Pa, V_A = 1 × 10⁻³ m³; State C: p_C = 1 × 10⁵ Pa, V_C = 3 × 10⁻³ m³.
Evaluate p V for each state: p_A V_A = 300 Pa·m³; p_C V_C = 300 Pa·m³. The products are equal, so T is unchanged between A and C.
The temperature at A is given as 27 °C = 300 K.
Since p V is the same at C, the absolute temperature at C is also 300 K.
Convert back to Celsius: T_C = 300 K − 273 = 27 °C.
